page.title: 07Battlefield Church.
page.content: Battlefield Church was built on the site of the Battle of Shrewsbury. The actual building was constructed on the site of the burial pit where many hundreds of men were put into a mass grave. The church was a chantry church where priests were employed to say prayers for those who died in the Battle. It is built in the Perpendicular Style and has had restoration added during 1985. Inside there are the Coats of Arms of those great nobles who fought in the Battle of Shrewsbury including the Kings of England. There is also a pieta of the Virgin Mary holding the dead Christ, it is said to be older than the church itself. The Corbet Family have associations with the Church.
